metadata.dc:author: González Palomino, A
Trinidad Ramos, G
Montero García, C
Pardo Romero, G
Pantoja Hernández, C G
Blasco Huelva, A
Pino Rivero, V
metadata.dc:description: We report the case ofa 61 years old woman with multiple pathologies: HTA, diabetes, relapsing polychondritis, hypercholesterolemia, iatrogenic Cushing, cardiopathy, cystic fibrosis, etc. She began, an increment of TA (220/130 mm Hg) or hypertensive crisis, with a sudden left cervical hematoma located on the carotid bifurcation according to CT imaging. We oractice an arteriography that was informed as normal and the patient was admitted and controlled of an ORL as Vascular Surgeon. The bleeding stop spontaneously we treat the patient conservativity.
metadata.dc:title: Hematoma cervical brusco tras crisis hipertensiva. Presentación de un caso.
[Sudden cervical hematoma after hypertensive crisis. Report of a case].
